question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Stale Rates] If storage::get_current_rate at line 269 returns stale rates that haven't been updated, can indices be calculated incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Zero Index] If current_supply_index or current_borrow_index from storage at line 268 is 0, ray_mul at lines 278/285 returns 0. Can this be exploited to reset indices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Rate Manipulation] If an attacker can manipulate current_supply_rate or current_borrow_rate through storage, can they artificially inflate or deflate indices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Compounded vs Linear] The function uses compounded interest for borrow (lines 274-278) but linear for supply (lines 281-285). Can this discrepancy be exploited for arbitrage? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [No Timestamp Update] The function calculates indices but doesn't update last_update_timestamp. If called multiple times, will it compound interest multiple times for the same period? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Input Validation] The assert at line 299 prevents both estimate values from being non-zero, but can an attacker call with both zero to get incorrect APY calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Normal Amount Conversion] At lines 306-307 and 311-312, pool::normal_amount is called. Can this conversion cause precision loss leading to incorrect APY calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Rate Dependency] The function calculates borrow_rate first (lines 315-322) then uses it for supply_rate (lines 324-332). Can manipulation of borrow_rate calculation cascade to supply_rate? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Integer Overflow] Can the conversion from u64 to u256 at lines 319 and 330 combined with subsequent calculations cause overflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Utilization Manipulation] Since both rates depend on utilization calculated dynamically, can an attacker manipulate utilization to get favorable APY? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Estimate Value Bounds] There's no upper bound checking on estimate_supply_value or estimate_borrow_value. Can providing max u64 values cause issues? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Storage Mutation] The function takes &mut Storage. Can it be called in a way that mutates storage affecting subsequent calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Return Value Manipulation] The function returns (borrow_rate, supply_rate). Can the caller misuse these values if they don't match actual protocol state? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Clock Dependency] The function passes clock to rate calculations. Can clock manipulation affect APY in exploitable ways? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Asset Mismatch] If asset parameter doesn't match the CoinType of the pool, can this cause incorrect APY calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Utilization Dependency] The function depends entirely on dynamic_caculate_utilization at line 347. Can manipulating utilization calculation allow setting arbitrary borrow rates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Jump Rate Model] At lines 349-353, if utilization >= optimal_utilization, jump_rate_multiplier is applied. Can an attacker trigger jump rate to cause extreme rate changes? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Integer Overflow] Can base_rate + ray_mul(utilization, multiplier) + ray_mul(...) at line 352 overflow causing rate to wrap to a small value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Rate Factor Manipulation] If storage::get_borrow_rate_factors at line 345 returns manipulated values, can this allow setting arbitrary rates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Optimal Utilization Boundary] The condition at line 349 uses < optimal_utilization. Can edge cases at exactly optimal_utilization cause unexpected rate jumps? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Ray Math Precision] Multiple ray_mul operations at lines 350 and 352 can accumulate precision loss. Can this be exploited over many rate updates? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Underflow in Jump Rate] At line 352, (utilization - optimal_utilization) assumes utilization >= optimal_utilization. Can edge cases cause underflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Zero Rate Factors] If base_rate, multiplier, and jump_rate_multiplier are all 0, the function returns 0 borrow rate. Can this be exploited to borrow for free? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Utilization > 100%] If utilization can exceed ray() (100%), can the rate calculation produce incorrect results or overflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/dynamic_calculator.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Storage State] If storage state is inconsistent between getting rate factors and calculating utilization, can this cause incorrect rates? (Medium)
